A hot spring is a spring produced by the emergence of geothermally heated groundwater from the Earth's crust. Hot springs are in many places, especially in mountain<nowiki/>s.

Sources of heat.
The water issuing from a hot spring is heated by geothermal energy, i.e., heat from the Earth's mantle.
